title: Can Marine Corps reservists go to jump school? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are several reserve units that jump. 4th Recon, 3rd Force Recon, 4th Force Recon,3rd ANGLICO,4th ANGLICO and 6th ANGLICO. Active duty ANGLICO lost it’s jump status when someone with a lot of stars on their shoulder like General Berger with Tanks today disbanded the AD ANGLICO units in 1999,because Good Idea Fairy. They were reactivated but are still not on jump status.

Sure, as long as said Marine needed Jump School to do his job. And as long as his unit is willing to fund his 3wk TDY to Ft Benning. And as long as there is an available open slot for him to fill in the class roster.

Yea but you have to be in a jump billet. I.E. your job will require you to go to jump school. You don't just get to call everybody a leg cause cause its cool. You have to have a need not just cause you want to go.
Yes, if there is a opening, and you can convince your COC that you are needing the jump certification to achieve an MOS that requires it (that the Corps needs filled).
Only if he is in a position requiring jump status. You don't beli g to the Reserve, you belong to a unit with specific positions. You can only get training that can be used by that unit.
